text:
USING: APACHE 1.3.17 + mod_jk.so

Some browsers seem to POST forms with invalid Content-Length headers (greater 
than the data really posted), then Apache waits for the missing datas. As soons 
as the client click on the 'stop' button or whatever that closes the socket 
between browser and server, one httpd process enters an infinite loop  with one 
Ajp13Connectector thread. Trussing the looping apache process, it looks like 
this :

6766/1:         send(7, "12 4\0\0", 4, 0)                       = 4
6766/1:         recv(7, " A B\003", 4, 0)                       = 4
6766/1:         recv(7, "061FFA", 3, 0)                         = 3

reading AJP protocol : Send me more data, sorry I've none left.
My quick and dirty hack was to pass my forms into GET method, and kill the 
looping httpd processes (it turned my production servers back into a stable 
behaviour, hopefully !).. I don't have any patch to submit, sorry.

Hope this helps

This was fixed a long time ago. Please upgrade to 4.0.4 (or) 4.1.24 and latest
connectors.
